subject: From Spain
event:
I've received a nice email from Canal+, who are airing GAME OF THRONES in Spain.

They write:

================================
"... We aired yesterday the first episode of Game of Thrones.

It was a great success, it was one of the best series première for us.

We have prepared online material to support the series.

Here, you can find an interactive map of Westeros and the Free Cities: http://www.canalplus.es/conoceponiente. 

It will show the changes in the location of the characters with each episode.

Here, you can find a game called Grito de Guerra (in English it would be War Call) The main theme of the game is to be a major Lord, and you  have a Maester on your service. Just after each episode, a new challenge appears on the web - the Lord has to direct his Maester to success in the challenge. Also, participants fight each other and follow the developments of the game, as well as create new rules on Twitter, @gritoguerra. 

You can see it here: http://www.canalplus.es/gritodeguerra. "

==================================

I hope my Spanish fans are enjoying the show, and it's great to see all that Canal + is doing to support the series over there.

And as long as I'm talking about Spain, this is as good a time as any to mention that Parris and I will be heading back over to Gijon in 2012, for what will doubtless be another wonderful Semana Negra.

comments.article: Their interactive map is really impressive. They must have some really talented people working for them.
Wish to have it in english as well :)
Cool!

This is like a dream come true. I read GoT when I was 14 back in 2004, and nobody in my hometown (let alone my high school :D) new about the series. I got hooked immediately, read voraciously until 2006, and that was it....

...and now The Song is back with a vengeance. You've gotten here with zero marketing or advertising, just pure word of mouth. One person tells another who tells another, and almost everybody agrees the the books are awesome so it keeps expanding its audience. Many people who may have read the books loooong ago are excited because of the series. It will hook people back.


And I say it's a dream come true, because it could've been a disaster like that Atlas Shrugged movie, or some kind of "Xena and King Arthur meet in Westeros" or something like that. But HBO has stayed true to the story. Canal+ is also doing a fantastic job, sadly it's a paid channel so not many people have it in Spain but the series is also coming to Nitro which is free.

All I can say is, thank you Martin.
comments.subject: Hell yeah

comments.article: If any of you want to play "Grito de Guerra" let me know and I'll invite you!! :D

Heading to spain??!?!? You should be writing TWOW!!!








jk :P

Btw, AMAZING ep tonight.

comments.upictitle: That's me, you know: game of thrones
comments.article: We are actually enjoying it!!! Promise!!! xDDD
I want to cry, right now, because Canal + is a French channel, but in France it was Orange which no one has that got the rights :(
O My God!!! Always wanted to attend the Semana Negra... And this should be the time!! Welcome back to Spain, mr Martin!!

Wow, you're back? We will be there to see you again! Here in Spain we've missed you so much since your last visit ;) Here we wait, and remember, you've got to learn the 'real' meaning of "singermornings" before you come to Gijón.
PS. And I'm making a lot of sangría, just in case this time I can convince you to tell us WHO are Jon Snow's parents hahahaha ;)
¡BIEN! ¡Bien, bien, bien, bien, bien! XXV Semana Negra will be something to remember! Welcome aboard! :)
comments.subject: Semana Negra

comments.article:
Canal + Game of Thrones' première was one of the most succesful premières the channel has had, for what I've heard. Everyone is pretty happy with the voice dubbing and amazed with the plot. They're airing episode 2 tonight ;)

About Gijón's Semana Negra 2012... I'm SOOO gonna be there, just as last time. Hope they have another Espicha so we can dress up again and sing El Oso :P We hopefully will have "Danza de dragones" by that time too!

What a wonderful monday :)

Take care!
comments.subject: Glad to read the good news!

comments.article:
We are enjoying it here in Spain, but like someone says above, canal + it's a paid channel, so we watch it on internet ^^U . Besides, many of us prefer the original voices with subtitles instead of a spanish dubbing ^^U
But it's cool, so many spanish people it's readin' now the series because of the show.

I think "War Cry" would be a better translation =)

comments.upictitle: Natalia a.k.a. Xiperita: ASOIAF: Tyrion lema Lannister
comments.article: YAY!, Gijón again, I'll be there for sure :-D
Oh no, you are going to Gijón and I'm in Japan this year!!! I can't believe this!
Mmm.. I'm about to give birth to my baby girl. Maybe I'll sew a little night watch uniform for the event... I don't see her in dothraki rags, as Vyseris would say...

Dear George, thanks for all your affection to us Spaniards :) Wish I could go to that Semana Negra to greet you and thank you for all the great time spent with ASOIAF. And now, as a bonus, with the series!!

Love,
Claudia (Spain)
Spanish fans are really enjoying Khal Drogo! Ehr... I mean... Enjoying the whole serie!
Congratulations, eh!;0)))

Greetings from Spain, mr. Martin! I've been watching the HBO Game of Thrones series in the original audio version whenever I can, and also tried to watch the Canal+ spanish voicing- which, even if it's sad, is pretty bad. But at least we can watch it in our language now!

I just wannted to thank you for all the wonderful things you've created. My imagination has been more active ever since I started to read you!

Oh, and I also read Fevre's Dream last month. It actually scared me a bit and everything!

I'm hoping I'll be able to go to Gijón next year, since it's pretty near to where I'll be living, but my student budget is pretty small for it to be probable -- what a pit it is! =(
comments.subject: Shou Hellscream

comments.article: Uhm... George, i'm not happy about the Canal+'s work. The voices are... a crime. ¿How can it be that Tyrion Lannister have the same voice than Lucius Malfoy (an snake appearance mage from Harry Potter)? Arya voice is like a flute, and the rest are too similar to recognize them. I loved starting watching the show in English with subtitles and i will continue that way. Sorry for Canal+.

Yes, we are enjoying the show (and I'm enjoying knowing what's going to happen while my friends, who are all hooked on the show, have no idea!)

I think Canal + has done a great job with the web =)
We are VERY VERY happy in Spain with the TV serie! The voices are very good and canal+ do not have commercial so we can se the full show without stops :D It's fantastic!
comments.subject: Spain say...

comments.article:
Sure, we're enjoying it big time! Since it was aired it had not passed a day without seeing or hearing people talking about it or (re-)reading the books.
About your visit, yay, I'll start to dust off my "Martin is coming" shirt!

Would you both sing the Oso's song along with us? :D

See you in Gijon!!

You made my day.
